page.title: 10Agriculture in The Lee
page.content: There are 11 farms covering this area, of which Church & Home Farm combine to form the Manor Estate. Use of land is evenly divided by arable & pasture. 1 farm has a milking herd of 80 cows & other pasture for store cattle & sheep. Work is mainly done with tractors, & some hedges have been removed to make larger fields. The largest farm has 5 tractors; a farm in Lee Common has very little land but rents where possible & 2 brothers do contract work with their machinery. Apart from the Manor, farms are under 150 acres. There is a small area of factory farming; there are broiler houses in Swan Bottom. Several small paddocks, separate from the farms in various locations, provide pasture for horses. The woodland, owned by the Liberty Estate, is well managed larch & beech.
